channel.title: Help with AVG Anti-Spyware!
channel.description:
Well, I just got AVG Anti-Spyware today and I did a full scan on my computer. I got some trojans and viruses after the scan was complete, now... how do I delete or fix the problems?? What do I click on? Ignore once or Save Report?
Please post ASAP!

item.title: Help with AVG Anti-Spyware!
item.dc:creator: @Cunit Cunit
item.description:
@Cunit wrote:

k now prob…some you cant delete i got a few so if they say they cant be deleted than just quarenteen them and your safe

Read full topic

item.title: Help with AVG Anti-Spyware!
item.dc:creator: @Yoshi0308 Yoshi0308
item.description:
@Yoshi0308 wrote:

Okay, how do I quarenteen it? Please reply, I’m a noobie at AVG.

EDIT: I have version 7.5.1.43, and I updated the virus scanner.

EDIT: Okay I found out, but instead of quarenteening it, I deleted it. Thanks for yer help mate.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with AVG Anti-Spyware!
item.dc:creator: @Cunit Cunit
item.description:
@Cunit wrote:

Try to quarenteen them once quarenteened there should be a vault and you can transfer them there. if they cant be stored in vault thats ok because if there quarenteened they will be Isolated in an area where it can no longer effect your computer…

hope it helps if thats what your looking for

Edit: i just looked at mine and it should of already transfered them automaticly if you have the same version i do

Read full topic
